page.title: 20COOPERS GREEN POND
page.content: Coopers Green Pond is in grid square 7850 and is used by the cows grazing on Brassingtons Farm.It used to be an old marl pit when clay was dug out for the pottery industry.It is at least 50 years old.It is 30 paces wide and 31 paces long and is fed by an underground spring in the middle of the pond and it has never dried up even in very dry weather. It is not known how deep the pond is exactly and local people argue as to how deep it really is.However it is known that two people have commited suicide in it in the past - one a local painter and the other a Mrs Johnson. Some people say it may be haunted but Mr Nield and Mr Holdway who live nearby say that it is only the cows and some wild foxes who use the pond today. D.Harper & D.Durber.
